newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Four-tonne statue of Lenin stolen from Kazakh park.
newsitem.headline: Four-tonne statue of Lenin stolen from Kazakh park.

text.p: A bronze statue of Vladimir Lenin weighing four tonnes was stolen overnight from a park in Taraz in southern Kazakhstan, Russia's Itar-Tass news agency said on Friday.
The only signs left by the robbers were the tracks of heavy vehicles around the monument's pedestal, the agency said.
Police ruled out a political motive for the theft, saying the statue of the Russian revolutionary leader had probably been taken to melt down and sell as metal scrap.

A task force has been set up to track down the missing Lenin while security has been stepped up at the park, where a number of statues of the Bolshevik chief are on show in an exhibition of Soviet symbols put on by the town authorities, Tass said.
